scenes.narrationScript: Active listening is more than just hearing words. It involves paying full attention, understanding the message, responding thoughtfully, and remembering what was said. Let's explore three key techniques: maintaining eye contact, paraphrasing to confirm understanding, and asking clarifying questions.
scenes.onScreenText:
Active Listening Techniques:
• Maintain eye contact
• Paraphrase to confirm
• Ask clarifying questions

scenes.narrationScript: Let's apply what you've learned. You're in a meeting where a colleague is expressing concerns about a project deadline. How will you respond using active listening?
scenes.onScreenText: Scenario: A colleague is worried about meeting a tight deadline. Choose your response:

visual.aiPrompt: Realistic office meeting room with two professionals in discussion, one expressing concern, the other ready to respond
visual.altText: Two professionals in a workplace meeting discussing project concerns

interactionDetails.title: Scenario: Active Listening in Action
interactionSteps: Consider the situation and potential outcomes

feedbackRules.correct: Excellent! Your response demonstrates strong active listening skills.
feedbackRules.incorrect: This approach might miss key concerns. Consider using more active listening techniques.
feedbackRules.neutral: Each choice has different outcomes. Consider which best demonstrates active listening.

templateData.scenarioText: Your colleague Sarah says: 'I'm really stressed about this deadline. We have so much to do and I don't think we'll make it. I'm worried the quality will suffer if we rush.'

choices.text: Make eye contact and say: 'It sounds like you're concerned about both the timeline and the quality of our work. Can you tell me more about which tasks are most worrying?'
choices.rationale: This response uses eye contact, paraphrasing, and clarifying questions - all three active listening techniques.

choices.text: Say: 'Don't worry, we'll figure it out. We always do.'
choices.rationale: This dismisses Sarah's concerns without demonstrating active listening.

choices.text: Say: 'I hear you. Let me paraphrase - you're worried about meeting the deadline while maintaining quality. Is that right? What specific areas concern you most?'
choices.rationale: Excellent use of paraphrasing and clarifying questions to ensure understanding.
